Martha Gulati, MD, MS, FACC, FAHA is an Associate Professor of Medicine in the Division of Cardiology at The Ohio State University.

She is also the Sarah Ross Soter Chair in Women's Cardiovascular Health and the Section Director for Preventive Cardiology and Women's Cardiovascular Health at The Ohio State University.

The standard heart rate formula (220 - your age) was designed for men.

This app uses a new formula (206 - 0.88 * your age) that is designed for women to more accurately calculate your target heart rates.

50\%% of this rate is your aerobic threshold.

85\%% of this rate is your anaerobic threshold.

METs, or Metabolic Equivalents of Tasks, are a measure of the energy required for a task.

They are calculated using metabolic rates, which are the amount of energy consumed by your body during tasks. The METs value for a task is obtained by dividing its metabolic rate to a resting rate.

Your target METs for a day = 14.7 - 0.13 * your age
